channel.title: Srl newest version
channel.description: anyone have the newest version of srl without the trojan they are trying to make you download?

item.title: Srl newest version
item.dc:creator: @IP-Drowner IP-Drowner
item.description:
@IP-Drowner wrote:

That’s only the version from Kaitnieks’ server. It is NOT the latest version, the latest version of SRL can be downloaded via the Subversion Repository. Guides on how to do this can be found at SRL.

Read full topic

item.title: Srl newest version
item.dc:creator: @LikeLightning LikeLightning
item.description:
@LikeLightning wrote:

the newest version of SRL can be downloaded through 3.15 (newest version), just click file and download includes + SLR

Read full topic

item.title: Srl newest version
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“IP-Drowner, post:8, topic:222168”][quote author=Niall link=topic=291800.msg2356394#msg2356394 date=1217333180]

Some virusscanners are currently making SCSS, one of my older programs which comes with SRL as a threat, though it’s not, it will be removed from SRL in the next revision as it it obsolete. Updates have rendered it broken and I am not planning on resuming the project as it’s old and unstable.

There is ScarScape still Even though, SCSS = Shit Compared to Scar Scape

That’s because SS was a client edit that locked map north, and fixed colours, SCSS was only a client loader with some fancy features.
[/quote]
It was??? I thought it was like a ScarScape because of the name, never used it though :o[/quote]

ScarScape WAS for Scar, thus the name, it made scripts ridiculously easy and this was the time before SRL so the walking features weren’t exactly amazing.

Read full topic

item.title: Srl newest version
item.dc:creator: @IP-Drowner IP-Drowner
item.description:
@IP-Drowner wrote:

There is no Trojan in SRL or SCAR. It is a false warning, since it modifies things similar to that of a Trojan. Just put an exception on the Anti-Virus you’re using. By the way, i am Using BitDefender, Spyware Doctor, ZoneAlarm and Kaspersky and they do not detect anything, and they’re the top of the range scanners

Read full topic
